Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel A
Reviews.Content: Situated very near to Beyazit market (Beyazit Mosque, Grand Bazaar), and at 15 minutes walk to Hippodrome (where are St Sophia Museum, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace), this recent renovated hotel join all conditions to meet the expectations of the tourists. The staff is friendly and useful (a special appreciation for the manager), everything is very clean. The breakfast is variate and very good. At the end of the stay â€“ the possibility to be transferred to airport with a shuttle at a cheap price (10 euros per person).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PlatoBerlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for nine nights. What a great location: 5 minutes walk to the suburb train to reach all sites of the old city, though you can reach them by walking as well. 10 minutes walk to the tram for Galata and Kambatas. 10 minutes for the Great Bazar. 5 minutes for Hamam Kadirga (Liman Cad. 127). Right around a good beerhouse. The quarter Kumkapi offers shops without tourist stuff. The restaurants in 2 min. reach are not overwhelming, but go to the harbour across Kennedy Cad., and you find good fish restaurants like Havuzbasi in 5 min. distance. The hotel is clean, the BF is what you expect in a 3-Star Turkish Hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was tiny and had not much place to stow things, leave them in your suitcase, and you're fine. TV (but who needs that when visiting Istanbul, a small fridge, a little cubic table. The walls are not really isolating from the neighbour's noises. Still, when you are asleep, the others are as well. Lights are a bit dim, especially where the "wardrobe" with safe is. Would I go therre again? Yes, certainly.

Reviews.Title: “nice days nice value small room!!”
Reviews.Author: eslamandvicky
Reviews.Content: i have spent wonderful time from 1.09.2011 to 9.09.2011 in this hotel. staff are so good friendly restaurant is always clean but the rooms are very small and all the TV channels are in turkey no internationals calls from the room other wise its nice clean, in nice place (grand bazaar) and Kumkapi station area.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BIM_in_tour
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Kumkapi station and its restaurants and also in a walking distance to Beyazit Mosque & Grand Bazar, so that the location is good for sightseeing and public transportation. The staff is very friendly and the rooms were clean and quite silent, even though not very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in real Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VimVic
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much. Itâ€™s in a walking distance to main attractions of Istanbul. This is definitely NOT a tourist area, just a real Istanbul with itâ€™s hardworking people. Nearby streets are not great however itâ€™s also close to â€œ100 restaurants districtâ€�. As on budget hotel rooms were spacious and staff altitude was exceptional. Bathroom was recently renovated and clean. Breakfasts in a buffet style, but on request eggs, Turkish coffee or tee prepared. Iâ€™d recommend this hotel to budget travellers with sightseenig in mind, who want experience real Instanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this mistake:(”
Reviews.Author: 3May5
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I decided that I can disregard the negative ones. That was my mistake! The only positive thing in the hotel is the staff. They were nice and helpful. Welcome coffee/tea was offered on arrival. When asked for a map we were told that it is not for free and were charged 5 TL. Just go to the Tourist info centre and will get map for free. Location was pretty OK, though not close to the public transport connections. 5 min walk to Kapalicarsi, where actually is the closest tram station; 15 min to Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. The rooms are small, but not that was the biggest issue. The furniture is very old, but repainted recently, bathroom seems to be renovated recently, but there is mold on the tile filling; shower cabin was additionally fixed which made it very incontinent, though it was new; the tap was not fixed in toward the sink and it was moving every time when using it, the toilet was very old and unclean. In general the bathroom is very badly maintained. We booked That is the feedback for 302 double bedroom, 304 twin bedroom was looking to the staircase, 304 triple room was the most decent among the three rooms that we had. The mattresses were with stains. The linens were changed on the third day.

Reviews.Title: “A trip almost spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: AdahV
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for five or six days and I am glad I had to go to Kapadokya the next day! The air-conditioning turns on and off because there is something wrong with the electricity. I had a restless night to cut it short.

Reviews.Title: “The best service I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: acia83
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 fabulous days in Istanbul, in the Grand Mark hotel. The hotel is well located, at walking distance from Grand Bazaar, Sultanhamet and all the main tourist attractions. The rooms were nice and clean, good relation quality-price. The breakfast was good as well. In general everything was great, but the strongest point is for sure the staff, who is extremely kind and always ready to assist you in a very friendly way. Definitely the best customer service I have ever seen in my trips. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, No-frills, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: jemimahileah
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location - a good walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, the famous Mosques (Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque) and other must-see areas in Istanbul. The room was ok, pretty clean and decent though quite small. The bathroom needed some fixing here and there (water leaked through the shower stall bec of some sealing problems). Breakfast was the same standard Turkish breakfast everyday. The staff were friendly. Free internet. The price is very reasonable. Overall, I would still recommend this hotel because of its value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a No Frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: malen_13
Reviews.Content: It's situated away from the tourist area. It's about a 5 minute walk uphill to the Grand Bazaar and a 15 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Haga Sofya. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was basic. A double size bed, small t.v, hair dryer, and had air conditioning. It was also quite clean. We are non-smokers and we didn't find the room smelled like smoke (according to other reviews listed). The bathroom was small. After taking a shower there would always be a puddle on the floor. We asked to change rooms the first day we arrived because we thought it was an isolated case with our room, but we had the same problem in the other hotel room they put us in. We would have to put a few towels on the floor to soak up the water. The bathroom would smell moldy the rest of the night before the cleaning staff would come in the next morning to clean the room. After a full day out in Istanbul, it was a little bit of a chore to walk back to the hotel since it was a bit outside of the tourist area. And because the hotel is outside the tourist area, it might be a little unsafe for single women travelers to walk downhill past all the men on the side streets. You could take a cab back to the hotel but we always walked since it was only a downhill walk from the main road. Breakfast was included in the rate. The Turkish breakfast was always fresh and pretty tasty. Everyday the hotel would have a spread of boiled eggs, tomatoes, cucumber, cheese, olives, luncheon meat, an assortment of bread, corn flakes, tea, coffee, orange drink, and water. I would recommend this hotel if want to stay in a No Frills hotel and you don't mind the walk to and from the main tourist areas, but if my husband and I decide to go back to Istanbul, we would stay somewhere closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.....”
Reviews.Author: NewShoes76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a friend recently for a week...From the moment we arrived there was trouble, First of all we were shown to our rooms which were right next to wide open door down the fire exit onto the street..V.dodgy! Then after being told the hotel was full to capacity, we were finally shown 4(!) other available rooms..Eventually we settled and the rooms in fairness were clean..the only good point.All amenities listed were made up..No 24 hr room service, broken window (had to eventually sellotape it shut myself!), No safe in friends room, Toilet leaking, No minibar, ironing facilities..Also this is very noisy hotel..Walls are paper thin..The location was also very run down and supposedly unsafe , although we didn see any hassle..Good location for sightseeing, close to everything although bit of an uphill struggle for elderly people...I think the worst thing about this hotel though for me was the attitude of the staff..They weren't in the least bit helpful about anything....Wouldn't recommend this hotel or area..Istanbul beautiful tho..had great hol otherwise...

Reviews.Title: “bad experience in grand mark”
Reviews.Author: ireland93
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for a week , hotel was in ok location with regards to sightseeing street itself very dirty and some locals told us dangerous at night. no safe in room no mini bar no 24 hour room service , no airport transfer hairdryer in bad state, window in friends room would not close when first arrived shown two very bad rooms told reception we would like to move, very unhelpful at first but eventually moved us. had a great holiday in istanbul but wished i booked another hotel so badically would not recommed hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and an absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: Bupster
Reviews.Content: This place isn't ideally situated, as there's a bit of an uphill walk to the Grand Bazaar and it's a ten minute stroll into the heart of Sultanahmet. Having said that, you won't find a better bargain on this side of the Golden Horn, and if you're happy to be out of the tourist melee then you could do a lot worse. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the water is hot and the showers powerful, the breakfasts do the job and the staff can't do enough for you. Very friendly, very kind, and made me endless cups of tea. A handy tip: the Kumkapi suburban railway station is just minutes away if you take a shortcut through the fish restaurants across the road. You can get a train to Sirkeci and change to the tram system there, or in the other direction I think it goes all the way to the airport. Very handy if you're carting luggage and don't want to traipse up the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, staff very friendly and helpful, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Lynatali
Reviews.Content: Very clean, amazingly friendly staff who were always willing to help and do everything to make my stay a pleasant one. The hotel is ideally located 15 minutes walk away from the Bazaar, Aghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The hotel was quiet and surrounded by local culture with banks, shops, restaurants and pretty much all you need etc on the doorstep. I will definitely return here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Mark Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cifte Gelinler Cad. 16, Istanbul, Turkey
